texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Introduction
texts.text: 1. Introduction

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC) intends to follow process-based approach to design, implement, improve and maintain information security across all group companies. GILAC looks at information security as a strategic issue and has therefore set up a Group Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) role to be primarily responsible for implementing and monitoring the GILAC's information security policies & processes. This entails creation of a framework which will govern the entire information security aspect.
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies (GILAC) intends to follow process-based approach to design, implement, improve and maintain information security across all group companies. GILAC looks at information security as a strategic issue and has therefore set up a Group Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) role to be primarily responsible for implementing and monitoring the GILAC's information security policies & processes. This entails creation of a framework which will govern the entire information security aspect.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Information Security is the protection of Information and Information Assets, from a wide range of threats in order to safeguard business and profits. It is the practice of defending information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, perusal, inspection, recording or destruction.
texts.text: Information Security is the protection of Information and Information Assets, from a wide range of threats in order to safeguard business and profits. It is the practice of defending information from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification, perusal, inspection, recording or destruction.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Information Security Management System (ISMS) is an overall management system, based on a business risk  approach,  to  establish  implement,  operate,  monitor,  review,  maintain  and  improve  information security. ISMS is a systematic approach to manage sensitive company information so that it remains secure. It encompasses People, Process and Technology.
texts.text: Information Security Management System (ISMS) is an overall management system, based on a business risk  approach,  to  establish  implement,  operate,  monitor,  review,  maintain  and  improve  information security. ISMS is a systematic approach to manage sensitive company information so that it remains secure. It encompasses People, Process and Technology.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1.4. Context of the organization
texts.text: 1.4. Context of the organization

texts.label: text
texts.orig: GILAC are a group of companies within Godrej Group. GILAC has significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals and financial services through its subsidiary and associate companies, across 18 countries. The combined market cap of GILAC's publicly listed entities is in excess of USD 15 billion. Ranked as the 2nd most trusted Indian brand, an annual revenue of USD 5 billion, and an estimated 1.1 billion customers across the world that use one or another Godrej product every day, the Godrej Group is amongst India's most diversified and trusted conglomerates.
texts.text: GILAC are a group of companies within Godrej Group. texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Policy
texts.text: 2. Policy

texts.label: text
texts.orig: GILAC has documented an Information Security Policy (ISMS Policy, this document) that outlines all the information security objectives to be met by GILAC. The information security policy of GILAC addresses several domains including security at people, technology and process levels. Also, there are supporting process and procedure documents available for various aspects of information security.
texts.text: GILAC has documented an Information Security Policy (ISMS Policy, this document) that outlines all the information security objectives to be met by GILAC. The information security policy of GILAC addresses several domains including security at people, technology and process levels. Also, there are supporting process and procedure documents available for various aspects of information security.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Information Security policy of GILAC shall be reviewed and updated at least annually or at major changes and communicated to all the users in the organization. In addition to the internal stakeholders, relevant sections of the ISMS Policy may be shared with external parties, on approval from CISO. The policy ensures that GILAC's information is protected and provides assurance to GILAC's customers and business partners.
texts.text: The Information Security policy of GILAC shall be reviewed and updated at least annually or at major changes and communicated to all the users in the organization. In addition to the internal stakeholders, relevant sections of the ISMS Policy may be shared with external parties, on approval from CISO. The policy ensures that GILAC's information is protected and provides assurance to GILAC's customers and business partners.

texts.orig: The policy statement is as follows:
texts.text: The policy statement is as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Information assets are important business assets to GILAC and needs to be appropriately protected in order  to  preserve  trust  and  confidence  of  customers,  Business  partners  and  regulatory  authorities  in GILAC, ensure business continuity and maximize return on investments and business opportunities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: At  GILAC,  the  management  views  information  security  as  a  critical  business  driver.  Management understands  the  business  risks  associated  with  ineffective  information  security  management.  The management  at  GILAC  is  committed  to  the  governance,  implementation,  systematic  operation, maintenance and improvement of the Information Security Management System (ISMS). The management expressly supports the following activities associated with effective information security management:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 4. Consequence Management and Non-Compliance
texts.text: 4. Consequence Management and Non-Compliance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All violations of security policies, standards and/or guidelines are subject to disciplinary action. The  specific  disciplinary  action  depends  upon  the  nature  of  the  violation,  the  impact  of  the violation on informational assets and related facilities, etc. Violations will be handled as per the existing HR processes and could range from verbal reprimand, to termination of employment/contract and/or legal action.
texts.text: All violations of security policies, standards and/or guidelines are subject to disciplinary action. The  specific  disciplinary  action  depends  upon  the  nature  of  the  violation,  the  impact  of  the violation on informational assets and related facilities, etc. Violations will be handled as per the existing HR processes and could range from verbal reprimand, to termination of employment/contract and/or legal action.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If a department or function is unable to comply with any requirements detailed within this policy, an exception shall be obtained. Such exceptions shall be documented and approved by the CISO or the Information Security Council indicating the rationale for the exception and the related risks.
texts.text: If a department or function is unable to comply with any requirements detailed within this policy, an exception shall be obtained. texts.label: text
texts.orig: Each BU (Business Unit) has its own 'Management committee' comprising of :
texts.text: Each BU (Business Unit) has its own 'Management committee' comprising of :

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU Head
texts.text: BU Head

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU HR Head
texts.text: BU HR Head

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU Finance Head
texts.text: BU Finance Head

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU IT Head
texts.text: BU IT Head

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Other BU Functional Heads
texts.text: Other BU Functional Heads

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Management Committee is responsible for:
texts.text: Management Committee is responsible for:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Ensure compliance to GILAC's policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security practices, and guidelines in various stages of IT development, implementation, operation and retirement across resp Business Unit.
texts.text: Ensure compliance to GILAC's policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security practices, and guidelines in various stages of IT development, implementation, operation and retirement across resp Business Unit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To oversee risk management framework to identify and deal with financial, model, operational, information security and cyber risks, and risks associated with the strategic direction, new products and change initiatives of the BU.
texts.text: To oversee risk management framework to identify and deal with financial, model, operational, information security and cyber risks, and risks associated with the strategic direction, new products and change initiatives of the BU.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The oversight of risk appetite and risk tolerance appropriate to each BU
texts.text: The oversight of risk appetite and risk tolerance appropriate to each BU

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To review the BU's risk policies, risk reports and breaches of risk tolerances and policies
texts.text: To review the BU's risk policies, risk reports and breaches of risk tolerances and policies

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To review the effectiveness of the BU's risk control/mitigation tools and risk management functions
texts.text: To review the effectiveness of the BU's risk control/mitigation tools and risk management functions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To monitor the effectiveness of controls across key risk types and controls to manage regulatory obligations and compliance risks across key functions
texts.text: To monitor the effectiveness of controls across key risk types and controls to manage regulatory obligations and compliance risks across key functions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Information Security Task Force
texts.text: Information Security Task Force

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Information Security Task Force is responsible for implementation of GILAC policies and procedures. The GILAC Information Security Task Force comprises of:
texts.text: Information Security Task Force is responsible for implementation of GILAC policies and procedures. The GILAC Information Security Task Force comprises of:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU SPOCs: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security  practices,  and  guidelines  in  various  stages  of  IT  development,  implementation, operation and retirement across resp Business Units.
texts.text: BU SPOCs: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security  practices,  and  guidelines  in  various  stages  of  IT  development,  implementation, operation and retirement across resp Business Units.

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BU HR: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC's policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security practices, and guidelines across the HR function.
texts.text: BU HR: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC's policies and procedures by incorporating cyber security practices, and guidelines across the HR function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber Security Team: - Development and ongoing maintenance of cyber security policies and procedures; Identify, access and monitor cyber security incidents; conduct cyber security related awareness campaigns across GILAC; Identification and mitigation of Cyber Security vulnerabilities.
texts.text: Cyber Security Team: - Development and ongoing maintenance of cyber security policies and procedures; Identify, access and monitor cyber security incidents; conduct cyber security related awareness campaigns across GILAC; Identification and mitigation of Cyber Security vulnerabilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Audit Team: - Conduct internal audits and vendor/third-party assessments to ensure the control objectives,  controls,  processes  and  procedures  of  GILAC  Information  Security  Management System  are  in  conform  to  the  standard,  effectively  implemented,  working  as  expected,  and properly maintained.
texts.text: Audit Team: - Conduct internal audits and vendor/third-party assessments to ensure the control objectives,  controls,  processes  and  procedures  of  GILAC  Information  Security  Management System  are  in  conform  to  the  standard,  effectively  implemented,  working  as  expected,  and properly maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT Team: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC's policies and procedures across the entire GILAC IT infrastructure.
texts.text: IT Team: - Responsible for implementation of GILAC's policies and procedures across the entire GILAC IT infrastructure.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 6. Contacts with relevant authorities
texts.text: 6. Contacts with relevant authorities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization shall identify when and by whom authorities (e.g. law enforcement, regulatory bodies,  supervisory  authorities)  should  be  contacted  and  how  identified  information  security incidents should be reported in a timely manner.
texts.text: The organization shall identify when and by whom authorities (e.g. law enforcement, regulatory bodies,  supervisory  authorities)  should  be  contacted  and  how  identified  information  security incidents should be reported in a timely manner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Contacts with authorities shall also be used to facilitate the understanding about the current and upcoming expectations of these authorities (e.g. applicable information security regulations).
texts.text: Contacts with authorities shall also be used to facilitate the understanding about the current and upcoming expectations of these authorities (e.g. applicable information security regulations).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 7. Risk Management
texts.text: 7. Risk Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Risk  assessment exercise shall be conducted at least annually to identify and evaluate various information security risks faced by GILAC and to prioritize the required controls based on the business impact and the likelihood of risk occurring.
texts.text: Risk  assessment exercise shall be conducted at least annually to identify and evaluate various information security risks faced by GILAC and to prioritize the required controls based on the business impact and the likelihood of risk occurring.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Respective BUs will be responsible for identifying risks, developing a plan, tracking and treating the risks for their resp assets.
texts.text: Respective BUs will be responsible for identifying risks, developing a plan, tracking and treating the risks for their resp assets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Business Head shall be responsible for signing off any identified risks that are accepted.
texts.text: Business Head shall be responsible for signing off any identified risks that are accepted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Status of Identified risks and corresponding treatment plan shall be reviewed by the management committee on annually.
texts.text: Status of Identified risks and corresponding treatment plan shall be reviewed by the management committee on annually.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 8. Training and Awareness
texts.text: 8. Training and Awareness

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Online training and awareness programs shall be conducted annually for all employees based on current  Cyber  Security  Threat  Landscape.  Relevant  records  shall  be  maintained  for  reporting purpose.
texts.text: Online training and awareness programs shall be conducted annually for all employees based on current  Cyber  Security  Threat  Landscape.  Relevant  records  shall  be  maintained  for  reporting purpose.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Mandatory  online  trainings  shall  be  assigned  to  newly  joined  employees  with  respect  to organizations polices, standards and guidelines. Trainings with respect to cyber security awareness shall also be mandated.
texts.text: Mandatory  online  trainings  shall  be  assigned  to  newly  joined  employees  with  respect  to organizations polices, standards and guidelines. Trainings with respect to cyber security awareness shall also be mandated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Organization shall identify and assign role-based security trainings for roles that require specific knowledge and expertise as part of their day-to-day operations.
texts.text: Organization shall identify and assign role-based security trainings for roles that require specific knowledge and expertise as part of their day-to-day operations.

texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Completion and attendance shall be mandated where required and possible consequences shall be defined for non-adherence by the respective BU HR Teams.
texts.text: Completion and attendance shall be mandated where required and possible consequences shall be defined for non-adherence by the respective BU HR Teams.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · An overall assessment of the employee's understanding where required shall be conducted at the end of an awareness, education, and training course to test knowledge transfer.
texts.text: An overall assessment of the employee's understanding where required shall be conducted at the end of an awareness, education, and training course to test knowledge transfer.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 9. Documentation
texts.text: 9. Documentation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall  document  all  the  information  required  by  the  standards,  and  requirements  of  its Information Security Policies which are necessary for the effectiveness of the information security management system.
texts.text: GILAC shall  document  all  the  information  required  by  the  standards,  and  requirements  of  its Information Security Policies which are necessary for the effectiveness of the information security management system.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All supporting policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually and revision history shall be maintained.
texts.text: All supporting policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually and revision history shall be maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All the documented information of GILAC in paper or electronic form shall be created and updated appropriately with identifications and descriptions such as title, date, author, version no., change details and review frequency.
texts.text: All the documented information of GILAC in paper or electronic form shall be created and updated appropriately with identifications and descriptions such as title, date, author, version no., change details and review frequency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All the documented information shall be available when needed. The distribution, access, retrieval, use and storage of information documents shall be properly maintained and monitored.
texts.text: All the documented information shall be available when needed. The distribution, access, retrieval, use and storage of information documents shall be properly maintained and monitored.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 10. Internal audit
texts.text: 10. Internal audit

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Annual Internal Audits shall be carried out to provide information on whether ISMS conforms to GILAC's own requirements for its Information Security, the requirements of the standards and to evaluate effectiveness of the IT general controls. Corrective actions shall be taken in case of any non-conformity to the requirements.
texts.text: Annual Internal Audits shall be carried out to provide information on whether ISMS conforms to GILAC's own requirements for its Information Security, the requirements of the standards and to evaluate effectiveness of the IT general controls. Corrective actions shall be taken in case of any non-conformity to the requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The effectiveness of the corrective action taken shall be reviewed and changes shall be made to the information security management system, if required.
texts.text: The effectiveness of the corrective action taken shall be reviewed and changes shall be made to the information security management system, if required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All the information documents related to the detection of non-conformity and rectifying shall be retained as evidence.
texts.text: All the information documents related to the detection of non-conformity and rectifying shall be retained as evidence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  GILAC  shall  plan,  establish,  implement  and  maintain  an  audit  program  that  takes  into consideration the importance of the processes concerned and results of previous audits.
texts.text: The  GILAC  shall  plan,  establish,  implement  and  maintain  an  audit  program  that  takes  into consideration the importance of the processes concerned and results of previous audits.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The audit criteria and scope shall be defined. Such audits need to be performed as per the Internal Audit Plan approved by the Audit Head. Information Security Council can consider the internal audit findings and recommend the action plan to remediate the same.
texts.text: The audit criteria and scope shall be defined. Such audits need to be performed as per the Internal Audit Plan approved by the Audit Head. Information Security Council can consider the internal audit findings and recommend the action plan to remediate the same.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Audit Head reports the findings and the remediation steps recommended to resp BU IT Heads and the Head of Corporate IT.
texts.text: The Audit Head reports the findings and the remediation steps recommended to resp BU IT Heads and the Head of Corporate IT.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 11. Management Review
texts.text: 11. Management Review

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Information Security Council shall review the Information Security posture of the GILAC periodically to assess adequacy and effectiveness of the information security policy. Members of this committee shall review the following:
texts.text: Information Security Council shall review the Information Security posture of the GILAC periodically to assess adequacy and effectiveness of the information security policy. Members of this committee shall review the following:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 12. BYOD Security Policy
texts.text: 12. BYOD Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any  GILAC  Staff,  intern  who  intends  to  access  GILAC's  infrastructure  shall  be  allowed  only Mobile/Tablet Devices. Any service provider and third-party contractor, who intends to access Godrej Corp IT's infrastructure shall be allowed only 1 mobile/tablet device.
texts.text: Any  GILAC  Staff,  intern  who  intends  to  access  GILAC's  infrastructure  shall  be  allowed  only Mobile/Tablet Devices. Any service provider and third-party contractor, who intends to access Godrej Corp IT's infrastructure shall be allowed only 1 mobile/tablet device.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · BYOD program does not support personal devices (mobiles/tablets) using customized, 'rooted', or 'jail broken' versions of operating systems. The device must have a licensed version of the Operating System installed.
texts.text: BYOD program does not support personal devices (mobiles/tablets) using customized, 'rooted', or 'jail broken' versions of operating systems. The device must have a licensed version of the Operating System installed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users shall erase all information and software related to any previous employment, before using their device under this policy for the first time.
texts.text: Users shall erase all information and software related to any previous employment, before using their device under this policy for the first time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · In case, the device user is transferred, or retired / contract expired, or device is lost, the user shall notify IT team for de-registration of device and wiping off entire GILAC data stored on the mobile device (smart phones, tablets, etc.)
texts.text: In case, the device user is transferred, or retired / contract expired, or device is lost, the user shall notify IT team for de-registration of device and wiping off entire GILAC data stored on the mobile device (smart phones, tablets, etc.)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT Team shall at a minimum ensure that adequate security measures are implemented to ensure compliance to GILAC ISMS Policy.
texts.text: IT Team shall at a minimum ensure that adequate security measures are implemented to ensure compliance to GILAC ISMS Policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to the GILAC's network and business applications shall be restricted to only approved devices that meet a predetermined minimum-security configuration.
texts.text: Access to the GILAC's network and business applications shall be restricted to only approved devices that meet a predetermined minimum-security configuration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users are advised to keep their personal data separate from business data on their personally owned device in separate directories to reduce the possibility of disclosure.
texts.text: Users are advised to keep their personal data separate from business data on their personally owned device in separate directories to reduce the possibility of disclosure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Organization shall have the right to seize and forensically examine any personally owned device believed to contain, or to have contained, GILAC's data where necessary for investigatory or control purposes.
texts.text: Organization shall have the right to seize and forensically examine any personally owned device believed to contain, or to have contained, GILAC's data where necessary for investigatory or control purposes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC IT team shall have the right to enforce technical security controls such as access control, malware protection software and encryption.
texts.text: GILAC IT team shall have the right to enforce technical security controls such as access control, malware protection software and encryption.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · By acceptance of the BYOD policy, employees agree to disclosure and/or monitoring of device internet usage.
texts.text: By acceptance of the BYOD policy, employees agree to disclosure and/or monitoring of device internet usage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users  of  employee-owned devices shall be subject to a comprehensive and targeted security awareness campaign so that they clearly understand and can comply with the acceptable use policy.
texts.text: Users  of  employee-owned devices shall be subject to a comprehensive and targeted security awareness campaign so that they clearly understand and can comply with the acceptable use policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users (GILAC Staff, interns, service providers and third-party contractors etc.) at a minimum shall ensure that they:
texts.text: Users (GILAC Staff, interns, service providers and third-party contractors etc.) at a minimum shall ensure that they:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Operate the device in compliance with Information Security Policy.
texts.text: Operate the device in compliance with Information Security Policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Users  shall  obtain  written  approval  from  their  respective  Supervisor/  Head  of  the department to access confidential or classified information using external devices.
texts.text: Users  shall  obtain  written  approval  from  their  respective  Supervisor/  Head  of  the department to access confidential or classified information using external devices.

texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.text: Page 14 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Exercise extra care to preclude the compromise, loss, or theft of the device, especially during travel.
texts.text: Exercise extra care to preclude the compromise, loss, or theft of the device, especially during travel.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Immediately  contact  GILAC  IT  Team  and  their  immediate  Supervisor/  Head  of  the department if the mobile device is lost, stolen, damaged, destroyed, compromised, or non-functional.
texts.text: Immediately  contact  GILAC  IT  Team  and  their  immediate  Supervisor/  Head  of  the department if the mobile device is lost, stolen, damaged, destroyed, compromised, or non-functional.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Control wireless network and service connectivity: Wi-Fi connectivity shall be turned off when not in  use,  and  users  shall  only  connect  their  devices  to  trusted  networks.  Devices  shall  be  set  to prompt users before connecting to networks so that users aren't unknowingly connecting to unsafe networks.
texts.text: Control wireless network and service connectivity: Wi-Fi connectivity shall be turned off when not in  use,  and  users  shall  only  connect  their  devices  to  trusted  networks.  Devices  shall  be  set  to prompt users before connecting to networks so that users aren't unknowingly connecting to unsafe networks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Never  store  confidential  data  on  a  device:  Users  shall  avoid  saving  any  sensitive  data  like password, personal, financial data on their devices. This precaution ensures that confidential data is safe even if a device gets compromised.
texts.text: Never  store  confidential  data  on  a  device:  Users  shall  avoid  saving  any  sensitive  data  like password, personal, financial data on their devices. This precaution ensures that confidential data is safe even if a device gets compromised.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employees shall not install freely available mobile applications from unauthorized sites which may collect data on the device.
texts.text: Employees shall not install freely available mobile applications from unauthorized sites which may collect data on the device.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Employee shall never access or use GILAC systems or company data through a device in a way that breaches any of other GILAC policies.
texts.text: Employee shall never access or use GILAC systems or company data through a device in a way that breaches any of other GILAC policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · On last working day of an employee, all company data (including work emails), and any software applications provided for business purpose, shall be removed from the device. If this cannot be achieved  remotely,  the  device  must  be  submitted  to  IT  Department  for  wiping  and  software removal.
texts.text: On last working day of an employee, all company data (including work emails), and any software applications provided for business purpose, shall be removed from the device. If this cannot be achieved  remotely,  the  device  must  be  submitted  to  IT  Department  for  wiping  and  software removal.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 13. Acceptable Use Policy
texts.text: 13. Acceptable Use Policy

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Refer 'Information Systems Acceptable Use Policy'
texts.text: Refer 'Information Systems Acceptable Use Policy'

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14. Human Resource Security
texts.text: 14. Human Resource Security

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14.1. During Recruitment
texts.text: 14.1. During Recruitment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · HR Team shall be responsible for performing background verification checks prior to recruitment of employees or engagement of staff on contract basis.
texts.text: HR Team shall be responsible for performing background verification checks prior to recruitment of employees or engagement of staff on contract basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information  security  responsibilities  for  all  staff  and  third-party  personnel  shall  be  specified  in terms and conditions of employment.
texts.text: Information  security  responsibilities  for  all  staff  and  third-party  personnel  shall  be  specified  in terms and conditions of employment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All staff and third-party personnel shall sign the Code of Conduct at the time of joining.
texts.text: All staff and third-party personnel shall sign the Code of Conduct at the time of joining.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  contractual  agreements  with  employees  and  contractors  shall  state  their  and  GILAC's responsibilities for information security. Terms and conditions of employment shall:
texts.text: The  contractual  agreements  with  employees  and  contractors  shall  state  their  and  GILAC's responsibilities for information security. Terms and conditions of employment shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. state that information security responsibilities extend outside normal working hours and premises and continue after employment has ended.
texts.text: state that information security responsibilities extend outside normal working hours and premises and continue after employment has ended.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. explain the employee's legal responsibilities and rights
texts.text: explain the employee's legal responsibilities and rights

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. include a non-disclosure / confidentiality clause
texts.text: include a non-disclosure / confidentiality clause

texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14.2. During Employment
texts.text: 14.2. During Employment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All staff and third-party personnel shall agree to perform their security responsibilities and comply with the requirements specified in the security policies.
texts.text: All staff and third-party personnel shall agree to perform their security responsibilities and comply with the requirements specified in the security policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All staff and third-party personnel shall be responsible for protection of any sensitive information and assets assigned to them.
texts.text: All staff and third-party personnel shall be responsible for protection of any sensitive information and assets assigned to them.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All staff and third-party personnel shall use information processing systems and data residing on systems for authorized business purposes only.
texts.text: All staff and third-party personnel shall use information processing systems and data residing on systems for authorized business purposes only.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All  staff  and  third-party  personnel  shall  report  any  suspected  information  security  incident  or weaknesses to his/her reporting manager and Cyber Security team.
texts.text: All  staff  and  third-party  personnel  shall  report  any  suspected  information  security  incident  or weaknesses to his/her reporting manager and Cyber Security team.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Cyber Security team shall ensure relevant cyber security awareness education and training (upon hire as part of induction and subsequently periodic) for all staff of GILAC and where relevant, third-party personnel.
texts.text: The Cyber Security team shall ensure relevant cyber security awareness education and training (upon hire as part of induction and subsequently periodic) for all staff of GILAC and where relevant, third-party personnel.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Cyber Security team shall monitor, review and measure the effectiveness of cyber security awareness through internal compliance and awareness tests.
texts.text: The Cyber Security team shall monitor, review and measure the effectiveness of cyber security awareness through internal compliance and awareness tests.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Business IT Head shall report all information security breaches committed by any employee to the HR head for taking necessary disciplinary actions against them.
texts.text: The Business IT Head shall report all information security breaches committed by any employee to the HR head for taking necessary disciplinary actions against them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 14.3. Termination and Change of employment
texts.text: 14.3. Termination and Change of employment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, communicated to the employee or contractor and enforced.
texts.text: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment shall be defined, communicated to the employee or contractor and enforced.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All physical and logical access privileges shall be revoked immediately when an authorized user no longer requires access to information or systems as part of their job, or when they leave GILAC. In case access needs to be retained, the same shall be approved by the HR team and resp BU SPOC.
texts.text: All physical and logical access privileges shall be revoked immediately when an authorized user no longer requires access to information or systems as part of their job, or when they leave GILAC. In case access needs to be retained, the same shall be approved by the HR team and resp BU SPOC.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · In the case of a contractor provided through an external party, the termination process is undertaken by the external party in accordance with the contract between the organization and the external party.
texts.text: In the case of a contractor provided through an external party, the termination process is undertaken by the external party in accordance with the contract between the organization and the external party.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Upon termination of employment/contract/agreement, internal staff and third-party personnel shall:
texts.text: Upon termination of employment/contract/agreement, internal staff and third-party personnel shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Return Assets that belong to GILAC
texts.text: Return Assets that belong to GILAC

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Confirm that they have destroyed all copies of information owned by GILAC.
texts.text: Confirm that they have destroyed all copies of information owned by GILAC.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The activities performed by a staff / third party may be subject to additional monitoring at the time  of  termination  or  change  of  employment,  on  communication  from  respective  Business representative (BU Head or BU SPOC). The department representative shall assume ownership and responsibility for monitoring related activities in co-ordination with IT.
texts.text: The activities performed by a staff / third party may be subject to additional monitoring at the time  of  termination  or  change  of  employment,  on  communication  from  respective  Business representative (BU Head or BU SPOC). The department representative shall assume ownership and responsibility for monitoring related activities in co-ordination with IT.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15.1. Ownership of Information Assets
texts.text: 15.1. Ownership of Information Assets

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All Information assets (hardware and software) shall be identified and have an asset owner.
texts.text: All Information assets (hardware and software) shall be identified and have an asset owner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · An asset custodian shall oversee and implement necessary safeguards to protect the assets per the classification level defined by the asset owner.
texts.text: An asset custodian shall oversee and implement necessary safeguards to protect the assets per the classification level defined by the asset owner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Asset reconciliation and verification shall be performed on bi-annual basis.
texts.text: Asset reconciliation and verification shall be performed on bi-annual basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15.2. Asset Register
texts.text: 15.2. Asset Register

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Business heads or Business SPOCs shall develop and maintain an asset register containing all assets within their business function.
texts.text: Business heads or Business SPOCs shall develop and maintain an asset register containing all assets within their business function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The asset register shall contain at a minimum, the asset type, asset location, owner, custodians and name of the function/processes that use those assets.
texts.text: The asset register shall contain at a minimum, the asset type, asset location, owner, custodians and name of the function/processes that use those assets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The asset register shall also maintain the CIA rating for all assets and accordingly label them as per the Asset Classification Scheme. (Refer Asset Management procedure for asset classification categories).
texts.text: The asset register shall also maintain the CIA rating for all assets and accordingly label them as per the Asset Classification Scheme. (Refer Asset Management procedure for asset classification categories).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Asset rating shall be reviewed on periodically as part of annual Risk Assessment exercise.
texts.text: Asset rating shall be reviewed on periodically as part of annual Risk Assessment exercise.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15.3. Information Classification and Handling
texts.text: 15.3. Information Classification and Handling

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Information Classification scheme shall be used to define an appropriate level of protection or special handling required for an information asset.
texts.text: The Information Classification scheme shall be used to define an appropriate level of protection or special handling required for an information asset.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The level of protection shall be commensurate with the classification level of the data.
texts.text: The level of protection shall be commensurate with the classification level of the data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The classification of the information shall be consistent with the business value of the data.
texts.text: The classification of the information shall be consistent with the business value of the data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information  shall  be  classified  using  GILAC's  Information  Classification  Scheme  as  tabulated below:
texts.text: Information  shall  be  classified  using  GILAC's  Information  Classification  Scheme  as  tabulated below:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15.4. Asset Retention and Disposal
texts.text: 15.4. Asset Retention and Disposal

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information owners shall define types of records and their retention requirements.
texts.text: Information owners shall define types of records and their retention requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Records which are no longer active shall be archived for a period of time as set forth in the GILAC Data Retention Schedule.
texts.text: Records which are no longer active shall be archived for a period of time as set forth in the GILAC Data Retention Schedule.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information shall be disposed when no longer needed subject to its retention schedule and approval by asset owner.
texts.text: Information shall be disposed when no longer needed subject to its retention schedule and approval by asset owner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Hardware assets and electronic records shall be disposed in a secure manner in accordance with the Asset Disposal guidelines.
texts.text: Hardware assets and electronic records shall be disposed in a secure manner in accordance with the Asset Disposal guidelines.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All assets destroyed in compliance with this policy shall require 'e-waste certificate' to be retained as per defined policy.
texts.text: All assets destroyed in compliance with this policy shall require 'e-waste certificate' to be retained as per defined policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Prior to disposal of system devices like Hard Drives, RAMs, etc., the same shall be sanitized by use of techniques like degaussing, low-level formatting, or physical destruction to ensure that data cannot be reconstructed.
texts.text: Prior to disposal of system devices like Hard Drives, RAMs, etc., the same shall be sanitized by use of techniques like degaussing, low-level formatting, or physical destruction to ensure that data cannot be reconstructed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 15.5. Media Handling
texts.text: 15.5. Media Handling

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All media containing sensitive data shall be stored in a secure safe, which shall be fire resistant and free of toxic chemicals.
texts.text: All media containing sensitive data shall be stored in a secure safe, which shall be fire resistant and free of toxic chemicals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to media library and media safe shall be restricted to authorized persons only.
texts.text: Access to media library and media safe shall be restricted to authorized persons only.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Prior to disposal of removable media, all data shall be securely deleted, or the media shall be destroyed.
texts.text: Prior to disposal of removable media, all data shall be securely deleted, or the media shall be destroyed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All incoming/outgoing media transfers shall be authorized and shall be checked against a gate pass.
texts.text: All incoming/outgoing media transfers shall be authorized and shall be checked against a gate pass.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Removable media shall be scanned for malware/anti-virus prior to providing read/write access.
texts.text: Removable media shall be scanned for malware/anti-virus prior to providing read/write access.

texts.orig: 16. Access Control Policy
texts.text: 16. Access Control Policy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.1. User Access Management
texts.text: 16.1. User Access Management

texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.orig: Page 20 of 41
texts.text: Page 20 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented to create user IDs and assign access privileges.
texts.text: A formal user registration and de-registration process shall be implemented to create user IDs and assign access privileges.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A unique ID shall be assigned to each user of information system to hold them responsible for their actions. User Ids shall follow a standard naming convention for all computer systems to facilitate user identification. Naming conventions shall cover all end users, contractors, consultants and vendors.
texts.text: A unique ID shall be assigned to each user of information system to hold them responsible for their actions. User Ids shall follow a standard naming convention for all computer systems to facilitate user identification. Naming conventions shall cover all end users, contractors, consultants and vendors.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A single user shall not be assigned more than one user ID on the same information system.
texts.text: A single user shall not be assigned more than one user ID on the same information system.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The administrator of Information systems shall not grant a user, access to any system without the authorization of the user's supervisor or manager.
texts.text: The administrator of Information systems shall not grant a user, access to any system without the authorization of the user's supervisor or manager.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The supervisors 0r managers shall revoke access rights of users in a timely manner who have either changed their job function or have been terminated.
texts.text: The supervisors 0r managers shall revoke access rights of users in a timely manner who have either changed their job function or have been terminated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Generic user IDs where necessarily required as an exception shall be assigned to a nominated user post approval from the respective Business Head or Business SPOC. The nominated user along with the Business head shall maintain the accountability, by whom, when and for what the generic ID is used.
texts.text: Generic user IDs where necessarily required as an exception shall be assigned to a nominated user post approval from the respective Business Head or Business SPOC. The nominated user along with the Business head shall maintain the accountability, by whom, when and for what the generic ID is used.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All vendor supplied default user IDs shall be disabled or removed where possible.
texts.text: All vendor supplied default user IDs shall be disabled or removed where possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC systems to be scanned to identify orphan IDs, dormant IDs, unauthorized IDs, etc. on a periodically as part of quarterly ID validation process. Same need to be deleted if not required. Exception to be raised for IDs which need to be retained with proper business justification.
texts.text: GILAC systems to be scanned to identify orphan IDs, dormant IDs, unauthorized IDs, etc. on a periodically as part of quarterly ID validation process. Same need to be deleted if not required. Exception to be raised for IDs which need to be retained with proper business justification.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to information and information technology resources shall be controlled, monitored, and authorized based upon user's job function, need-to-know and need-to-perform criteria.
texts.text: Access to information and information technology resources shall be controlled, monitored, and authorized based upon user's job function, need-to-know and need-to-perform criteria.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The access to specific functionalities in information systems and level of access required at the granular level of read, modify & update, deletion shall be identified and documented. These requirements shall be translated into system profiles for the different classes of business users.
texts.text: The access to specific functionalities in information systems and level of access required at the granular level of read, modify & update, deletion shall be identified and documented. These requirements shall be translated into system profiles for the different classes of business users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access privileges shall be assigned to a unique user ID that is mapped to an employee/Contractor based on individual's subscribed role, business need and security requirements.
texts.text: Access privileges shall be assigned to a unique user ID that is mapped to an employee/Contractor based on individual's subscribed role, business need and security requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Role based access shall be provided based on the systems profiles defined by the system and business owners.
texts.text: Role based access shall be provided based on the systems profiles defined by the system and business owners.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The use of Group and shared IDs shall be restricted and if it is absolutely required to use shared IDs, mechanisms shall be established to ensure traceability/audit trails of usage to individual users.
texts.text: The use of Group and shared IDs shall be restricted and if it is absolutely required to use shared IDs, mechanisms shall be established to ensure traceability/audit trails of usage to individual users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Request for change in the access right shall be documented and approved by the user's Manager or the respective Business SPOC.
texts.text: Request for change in the access right shall be documented and approved by the user's Manager or the respective Business SPOC.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Audit trails for all requests for additions, modifications or deletions of individual accounts and access rights shall be maintained.
texts.text: Audit trails for all requests for additions, modifications or deletions of individual accounts and access rights shall be maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access rights shall be defined based on the least privilege principle and be approved by user's Manager or the respective BU SPOC.
texts.text: Access rights shall be defined based on the least privilege principle and be approved by user's Manager or the respective BU SPOC.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The access rights of all employees and external party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.
texts.text: The access rights of all employees and external party users to information and information processing facilities shall be removed upon termination of their employment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.

texts.text: Page 21 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · User access shall be reviewed and access shall be disabled if the account is found to be inactive for a period of Ninety (90) days or more. If the same cannot be disabled, exception shall be taken from the CISO or the Information Security Council and same shall be maintained.
texts.text: User access shall be reviewed and access shall be disabled if the account is found to be inactive for a period of Ninety (90) days or more. If the same cannot be disabled, exception shall be taken from the CISO or the Information Security Council and same shall be maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT Operations shall enable user account lockout after five (5) unsuccessful attempts to logon to the system.
texts.text: IT Operations shall enable user account lockout after five (5) unsuccessful attempts to logon to the system.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users shall be required to re-authenticate themselves after a specific period of inactivity.
texts.text: Users shall be required to re-authenticate themselves after a specific period of inactivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · System lock duration shall be set to a maximum period of 5 minutes in case of system inactivity.
texts.text: System lock duration shall be set to a maximum period of 5 minutes in case of system inactivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access review for critical applications shall be done on quarterly basis.
texts.text: Access review for critical applications shall be done on quarterly basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.2. Privilege Access Management
texts.text: 16.2. Privilege Access Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Privileged users must be authenticated using either two-step or two-factor authentication, wherever applicable. A quality password is required along with additional authentication such as biometric, tokens, OTP, authenticator, etc.
texts.text: Privileged users must be authenticated using either two-step or two-factor authentication, wherever applicable. A quality password is required along with additional authentication such as biometric, tokens, OTP, authenticator, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The BU Head or BU SPOC shall approve the granting, modifications, and revocation of privilege accounts on respective information systems owned by that business unit.
texts.text: The BU Head or BU SPOC shall approve the granting, modifications, and revocation of privilege accounts on respective information systems owned by that business unit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Documented approvals shall be appropriately stored and produced by BU SPOCs when requested for their resp BU assets.
texts.text: Documented approvals shall be appropriately stored and produced by BU SPOCs when requested for their resp BU assets.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Privileges shall be assigned to user's identity.
texts.text: Privileges shall be assigned to user's identity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The use of privilege accounts such as root or administrator shall be discouraged.
texts.text: The use of privilege accounts such as root or administrator shall be discouraged.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Controls to monitor and track activity of privilege accounts shall be implemented.
texts.text: Controls to monitor and track activity of privilege accounts shall be implemented.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The activity logs of privilege users have to be stored in remote systems to prevent tampering of these logs.
texts.text: The activity logs of privilege users have to be stored in remote systems to prevent tampering of these logs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Privileged access rights shall be reviewed monthly.
texts.text: Privileged access rights shall be reviewed monthly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · When a privilege is granted on a temporary basis to a user, privileges shall be revoked after completion of that period.
texts.text: When a privilege is granted on a temporary basis to a user, privileges shall be revoked after completion of that period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Changes to privileged accounts shall be logged.
texts.text: Changes to privileged accounts shall be logged.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.3. Authentication Information Management
texts.text: 16.3. Authentication Information Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Authentication information such as passwords or personal identification numbers (PINs) generated automatically shall be non-guessable and unique.
texts.text: Authentication information such as passwords or personal identification numbers (PINs) generated automatically shall be non-guessable and unique.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The identity of a user shall be verified prior to providing a new or temporary authentication information
texts.text: The identity of a user shall be verified prior to providing a new or temporary authentication information

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Authentication information, including temporary authentication information shall be transmitted to users in a secure manner (e.g. over an authenticated and protected channel) and the use of unprotected channels for this purpose shall be avoided.
texts.text: Authentication information, including temporary authentication information shall be transmitted to users in a secure manner (e.g. over an authenticated and protected channel) and the use of unprotected channels for this purpose shall be avoided.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Randomly generated temporary passwords shall be provided to a new user initially and a password reset shall be enforced upon first login.
texts.text: Randomly generated temporary passwords shall be provided to a new user initially and a password reset shall be enforced upon first login.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Vendor default passwords shall be changed prior to use.
texts.text: Vendor default passwords shall be changed prior to use.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Passwords shall be secured during transmission and storage.
texts.text: Passwords shall be secured during transmission and storage.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 22 of 41
texts.text: Page 22 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Authentication information such as passwords shall be kept confidential and shall be shared only with authorized persons basis proper justification and approvals.
texts.text: Authentication information such as passwords shall be kept confidential and shall be shared only with authorized persons basis proper justification and approvals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The password policy shall address the following at the minimum:
texts.text: The password policy shall address the following at the minimum:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Password length should be a minimum of eight (8) characters for end users and ten (10) characters for privileged accounts.
texts.text: Password length should be a minimum of eight (8) characters for end users and ten (10) characters for privileged accounts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Passwords should be complex, consisting of any 3 out of 4 characters lowercase, uppercase, numerals and special character
texts.text: Passwords should be complex, consisting of any 3 out of 4 characters lowercase, uppercase, numerals and special character

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. Users shall be forced to change the passwords after first logon.
texts.text: Users shall be forced to change the passwords after first logon.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv. Domain users shall be forced to change their passwords at least every 90 days. Passwords should automatically expire if not changed within 90 days. Expired passwords for end user accounts should result in a forced password change upon next sign in. Users should not use last 5 passwords (password history).
texts.text: Domain users shall be forced to change their passwords at least every 90 days. Passwords should automatically expire if not changed within 90 days. Expired passwords for end user accounts should result in a forced password change upon next sign in. Users should not use last 5 passwords (password history).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: v. Privileged account passwords must be changed at least once every 90 days. Privileged Account Passwords should automatically expire if not changed within 90 days. Expired passwords for Privileged Accounts should result in an account lockout.
texts.text: Privileged account passwords must be changed at least once every 90 days. Privileged Account Passwords should automatically expire if not changed within 90 days. Expired passwords for Privileged Accounts should result in an account lockout.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vi. Default system privileged accounts such as root and administrator accounts are configured with 'password never expire' and the password shall be vaulted.
texts.text: Default system privileged accounts such as root and administrator accounts are configured with 'password never expire' and the password shall be vaulted.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.4. User Responsibilities for Access Management
texts.text: 16.4. User Responsibilities for Access Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users, contractors, consultants, etc. shall keep their passwords confidential and shall not share with any other individual.
texts.text: Users, contractors, consultants, etc. shall keep their passwords confidential and shall not share with any other individual.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users, contractors, consultants, etc. shall protect and/or report all unattended equipment appropriately.
texts.text: Users, contractors, consultants, etc. shall protect and/or report all unattended equipment appropriately.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.5. Network Access Control
texts.text: 16.5. Network Access Control

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Appropriate interfaces shall be created to segregate GILAC network from the networks owned by other organization and public networks.
texts.text: Appropriate interfaces shall be created to segregate GILAC network from the networks owned by other organization and public networks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users shall only be provided with access to the services that they have been specifically authorized.
texts.text: Users shall only be provided with access to the services that they have been specifically authorized.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Only authorized users shall be permitted to establish remote connections to the network using secure channels.
texts.text: Only authorized users shall be permitted to establish remote connections to the network using secure channels.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · An equipment identifier shall be used to authenticate all equipment connecting to the network.
texts.text: An equipment identifier shall be used to authenticate all equipment connecting to the network.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users connecting to the network shall be authenticated and their access attempts shall be logged.
texts.text: Users connecting to the network shall be authenticated and their access attempts shall be logged.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.
texts.text: The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls shall be restricted and tightly controlled.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.text: Page 23 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · User sessions shall be disabled after 15 minutes of inactivity so as to limit the connection time to sensitive network.
texts.text: User sessions shall be disabled after 15 minutes of inactivity so as to limit the connection time to sensitive network.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Vendor shall provide details of their employees who shall need access to GILAC network. Access shall be granted to only those vendor employees whose details have been provided to GILAC.
texts.text: Vendor shall provide details of their employees who shall need access to GILAC network. Access shall be granted to only those vendor employees whose details have been provided to GILAC.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.6. Application Access Control
texts.text: 16.6. Application Access Control

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Logical access to the application software shall be restricted to authorized users.
texts.text: Logical access to the application software shall be restricted to authorized users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to application functionalities shall be restricted based on business requirements.
texts.text: Access to application functionalities shall be restricted based on business requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · User access (except administrators) to data repositories shall be approved and recorded.
texts.text: User access (except administrators) to data repositories shall be approved and recorded.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Application accounts created for inter-application access shall not be used by individual users.
texts.text: Application accounts created for inter-application access shall not be used by individual users.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Application Owners shall be responsible for management of access rights to their respect applications.
texts.text: Application Owners shall be responsible for management of access rights to their respect applications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Application access for critical applications shall be reviewed on a quarterly basis.
texts.text: Application access for critical applications shall be reviewed on a quarterly basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.7. Segregation of Duties
texts.text: 16.7. Segregation of Duties

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access profiles for critical applications shall be designed to avoid potential segregation of duties conflicts.
texts.text: Access profiles for critical applications shall be designed to avoid potential segregation of duties conflicts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · SoD reviews to be conducted on quarterly basis to identify potential SoD conflicts.
texts.text: SoD reviews to be conducted on quarterly basis to identify potential SoD conflicts.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.8. Remote Access
texts.text: 16.8. Remote Access

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Remote access shall not be provided to employees/vendors/contractors by default. Remote access to network shall require an appropriate management approval and a valid business need.
texts.text: Remote access shall not be provided to employees/vendors/contractors by default. Remote access to network shall require an appropriate management approval and a valid business need.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Remote access request for third party vendor/consultant shall be raised by the GILAC employee responsible for the vendor /consultant engagement along with proper business justification. The request needs to be approved by BU SPOC and Cyber Security Manager.
texts.text: Remote access request for third party vendor/consultant shall be raised by the GILAC employee responsible for the vendor /consultant engagement along with proper business justification. The request needs to be approved by BU SPOC and Cyber Security Manager.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Remote user sessions shall be terminated after a maximum period of 15 minutes of inactivity.
texts.text: Remote user sessions shall be terminated after a maximum period of 15 minutes of inactivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Unauthorized inbound and outbound connections to and from GILAC network shall be prohibited.
texts.text: Unauthorized inbound and outbound connections to and from GILAC network shall be prohibited.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Remote access to the network shall utilize approved VPN (Virtual Private Network) infrastructure and multi-factor authentication.
texts.text: Remote access to the network shall utilize approved VPN (Virtual Private Network) infrastructure and multi-factor authentication.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All remote access to an internal network, whether through VPN, or other mechanism, shall be logged.
texts.text: All remote access to an internal network, whether through VPN, or other mechanism, shall be logged.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 16.9. Access to third Party Users
texts.text: 16.9. Access to third Party Users

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The designated manager within GILAC shall authorize and supervise access requirements for non-employees.
texts.text: The designated manager within GILAC shall authorize and supervise access requirements for non-employees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Basic information Security principles such as least privilege, Separation of duties and defense in depth shall be applied.
texts.text: Basic information Security principles such as least privilege, Separation of duties and defense in depth shall be applied.
