texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 17. Physical & Environmental Security Policy
texts.text: 17. Physical & Environmental Security Policy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 17.1. Physical Security
texts.text: 17.1. Physical Security

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Physical access to offices and information processing facilities shall be properly controlled for employees, contractors and visitors to prevent unauthorized access or damage to information systems.
texts.text: Physical access to offices and information processing facilities shall be properly controlled for employees, contractors and visitors to prevent unauthorized access or damage to information systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Physical access provided to secure areas such as the Data Centers, Network room, Server rooms, Disaster recovery sites etc. to employees/vendors/visitors shall be reviewed on quarterly basis.
texts.text: Physical access provided to secure areas such as the Data Centers, Network room, Server rooms, Disaster recovery sites etc. to employees/vendors/visitors shall be reviewed on quarterly basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Entry and exit to the premises shall be logged and monitored. In case of any major deviations/ suspected events noted, the same shall be notified to appropriate authorities.
texts.text: Entry and exit to the premises shall be logged and monitored. In case of any major deviations/ suspected events noted, the same shall be notified to appropriate authorities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Facilities shall be classified into zones and physical safeguards for each zone shall be designed and implemented at a level appropriate to the classification of the zone.
texts.text: Facilities shall be classified into zones and physical safeguards for each zone shall be designed and implemented at a level appropriate to the classification of the zone.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Appropriate physical security controls and monitoring capabilities shall be employed to detect and prevent disruptions to the information processing facilities.
texts.text: Appropriate physical security controls and monitoring capabilities shall be employed to detect and prevent disruptions to the information processing facilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Offices and information processing facilities shall be manned reception area to control physical access to resp premises.
texts.text: Offices and information processing facilities shall be manned reception area to control physical access to resp premises.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · CCTV cameras shall be installed at key locations of premises. Ensure that due diligence is exhibited during CCTV monitoring. CCTV recordings shall be retained for least for 1 month for Primary datacenter. For GodrejOne, recordings shall be retained at least for 10 days.
texts.text: CCTV cameras shall be installed at key locations of premises. Ensure that due diligence is exhibited during CCTV monitoring. CCTV recordings shall be retained for least for 1 month for Primary datacenter. For GodrejOne, recordings shall be retained at least for 10 days.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Visitor details shall be verified and entered into a visitor register/ visitor management system. Details regarding laptops, pen drives, CDs/ DVDs, floppies etc. shall be entered.
texts.text: Visitor details shall be verified and entered into a visitor register/ visitor management system. Details regarding laptops, pen drives, CDs/ DVDs, floppies etc. shall be entered.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Every visitor shall be provided with a visitor badge and the visitor shall display the badge at all times in the GILAC premises.
texts.text: Every visitor shall be provided with a visitor badge and the visitor shall display the badge at all times in the GILAC premises.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access cards provided to vendors/consultants shall have limited floor access. Cards unused for more than 30 days shall be disabled.
texts.text: Access cards provided to vendors/consultants shall have limited floor access. Cards unused for more than 30 days shall be disabled.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Visitor/Vendor personnel/third party personnel shall be escorted at all times inside the Datacenter or facilities housing critical information systems or equipment.
texts.text: Visitor/Vendor personnel/third party personnel shall be escorted at all times inside the Datacenter or facilities housing critical information systems or equipment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All employees and visitors shall display the access card at all times on premises. Also, all employees and visitors shall use their access cards (employee identification badges, visitor badges etc.) to obtain entry and exit to the premises.
texts.text: All employees and visitors shall display the access card at all times on premises. Also, all employees and visitors shall use their access cards (employee identification badges, visitor badges etc.) to obtain entry and exit to the premises.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Monitoring events and records for physical access (eg. access cards, biometric access, etc.) shall be stored for a minimum of three months or longer based on business and legal requirements.
texts.text: Monitoring events and records for physical access (eg. access cards, biometric access, etc.) shall be stored for a minimum of three months or longer based on business and legal requirements.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 17.2. Equipment Security
texts.text: 17.2. Equipment Security

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Equipment shall be secured from potential threats to prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise.
texts.text: Equipment shall be secured from potential threats to prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All cables, including power and telecommunication network cables shall be protected from damage or unauthorized interception.
texts.text: All cables, including power and telecommunication network cables shall be protected from damage or unauthorized interception.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 25 of 41
texts.text: Page 25 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT/ Network function shall ensure that any networking equipment, gateways, Wireless access points, telecommunication lines and cabling racks/ distribution points in the office area are not physically accessible to people other than IT/ Technical function.
texts.text: IT/ Network function shall ensure that any networking equipment, gateways, Wireless access points, telecommunication lines and cabling racks/ distribution points in the office area are not physically accessible to people other than IT/ Technical function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · It shall be ensured that all areas, where loading and unloading of items are done, are monitored.
texts.text: It shall be ensured that all areas, where loading and unloading of items are done, are monitored.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security personnel shall maintain an inward and outward register for all the incoming and outgoing materials.
texts.text: Security personnel shall maintain an inward and outward register for all the incoming and outgoing materials.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Delivery and loading areas shall be isolated and kept away from information resources. Delivery or loading shall not be permissible in restricted areas.
texts.text: Delivery and loading areas shall be isolated and kept away from information resources. Delivery or loading shall not be permissible in restricted areas.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All incoming IT equipment shall be inspected for hazardous and combustible materials at entry point to ensure the same is not allowed inside the premises.
texts.text: All incoming IT equipment shall be inspected for hazardous and combustible materials at entry point to ensure the same is not allowed inside the premises.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 17.3. Environmental Security
texts.text: 17.3. Environmental Security

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Air-conditioning systems shall be installed to support information systems and equipment like server rooms, network rooms, and disaster recovery sites.
texts.text: Air-conditioning systems shall be installed to support information systems and equipment like server rooms, network rooms, and disaster recovery sites.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Smoke detectors, fire detection and fire suppression equipment shall be installed in office premises and other sensitive areas for protection against any fire incidents.
texts.text: Smoke detectors, fire detection and fire suppression equipment shall be installed in office premises and other sensitive areas for protection against any fire incidents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Necessary fire drills and trainings shall be conducted for all employees on a periodic basis in case of any emergency. Emergency evacuation drills shall also be conducted to ensure emergency evacuation.
texts.text: Necessary fire drills and trainings shall be conducted for all employees on a periodic basis in case of any emergency. Emergency evacuation drills shall also be conducted to ensure emergency evacuation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Appropriate temperature and humidity controls shall be implemented, monitored and maintained.
texts.text: Appropriate temperature and humidity controls shall be implemented, monitored and maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Uninterruptible power supply (UPS) systems and generators shall be installed to support controlled shutdown or continued functioning of equipment supporting critical business operations
texts.text: Uninterruptible power supply (UPS) systems and generators shall be installed to support controlled shutdown or continued functioning of equipment supporting critical business operations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Appropriate water/ moisture sensors shall be installed to detect water leakage and seepage
texts.text: Appropriate water/ moisture sensors shall be installed to detect water leakage and seepage

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Critical information systems, storage media, document and assets shall not be located in areas susceptible to water seepage or flooding, or near combustible materials.
texts.text: Critical information systems, storage media, document and assets shall not be located in areas susceptible to water seepage or flooding, or near combustible materials.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A preventive maintenance exercise for the utility equipment (electrical equipment, fire equipment, AC, UPS, water leakage detectors, etc.) including alarm systems is carried out at scheduled intervals ensuring their continued availability and integrity.
texts.text: A preventive maintenance exercise for the utility equipment (electrical equipment, fire equipment, AC, UPS, water leakage detectors, etc.) including alarm systems is carried out at scheduled intervals ensuring their continued availability and integrity.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 18. Change Management Policy
texts.text: 18. Change Management Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A Change Advisory Board (CAB) shall be formed for approving and tracking critical changes.
texts.text: A Change Advisory Board (CAB) shall be formed for approving and tracking critical changes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A change management process shall be documented and established that shall at least include types of changes, recording of changes, business and security approvals, impact assessment due to  the  change,  testing  the  change,  roll  back  procedures  and  post  implementation  review  of changes.
texts.text: A change management process shall be documented and established that shall at least include types of changes, recording of changes, business and security approvals, impact assessment due to  the  change,  testing  the  change,  roll  back  procedures  and  post  implementation  review  of changes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Changes to system components shall be adequately controlled and shall be carried out only after changes are validated, documented and approved by authorized individuals.
texts.text: Changes to system components shall be adequately controlled and shall be carried out only after changes are validated, documented and approved by authorized individuals.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Page 26 of 41
texts.text: Page 26 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The potential business impacts of changes shall be assessed (for e.g., in terms of the overall risk and impact on other components of the application)
texts.text: The potential business impacts of changes shall be assessed (for e.g., in terms of the overall risk and impact on other components of the application)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Changes shall be reviewed to ensure that they do not compromise security controls (e.g., by checking software to ensure it does not contain malicious code, such as a Trojan horse or a virus)
texts.text: Changes shall be reviewed to ensure that they do not compromise security controls (e.g., by checking software to ensure it does not contain malicious code, such as a Trojan horse or a virus)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Back-out positions shall be established so that the system or application can recover from failed changes or unexpected results
texts.text: Back-out positions shall be established so that the system or application can recover from failed changes or unexpected results

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Changes to the system or application shall be performed by skilled and competent individuals who are capable of making changes correctly and securely.
texts.text: Changes to the system or application shall be performed by skilled and competent individuals who are capable of making changes correctly and securely.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Changes shall not be carried out directly in the production environment unless required during contingency (for emergency changes) with prior authorization.
texts.text: Changes shall not be carried out directly in the production environment unless required during contingency (for emergency changes) with prior authorization.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any deviations from the implementation plan shall be recorded and approved by the Change Manager and informed to CAB.
texts.text: Any deviations from the implementation plan shall be recorded and approved by the Change Manager and informed to CAB.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Status  of  Changes  (e.g.,  successful,  failed,  cancelled,  etc.)  post  activity  shall  be  recorded  and communicated to the change manager or change management team.
texts.text: Status  of  Changes  (e.g.,  successful,  failed,  cancelled,  etc.)  post  activity  shall  be  recorded  and communicated to the change manager or change management team.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  change  manager  or  change  management  team  shall  ensure  that  status  of  all  changes  is informed and updated by resp activity SPOCs within the required timeframe.
texts.text: The  change  manager  or  change  management  team  shall  ensure  that  status  of  all  changes  is informed and updated by resp activity SPOCs within the required timeframe.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Record of changes shall be maintained for at least a period of 1 year.
texts.text: Record of changes shall be maintained for at least a period of 1 year.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 19. Security Incident Management Policy
texts.text: 19. Security Incident Management Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Processes  shall  be  implemented  and  documented  to  manage  information  security  incidents including but not limited to incident detection, reporting, ownership, classification, investigation, resolution and closure.
texts.text: Processes  shall  be  implemented  and  documented  to  manage  information  security  incidents including but not limited to incident detection, reporting, ownership, classification, investigation, resolution and closure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A formal incident management process shall be documented for timely detection, reporting and management of information security incidents within the organization's computing environment.
texts.text: A formal incident management process shall be documented for timely detection, reporting and management of information security incidents within the organization's computing environment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security incidents shall be reported from all relevant sources, including users, audit process, SOC, advisory team, customers, etc.
texts.text: Security incidents shall be reported from all relevant sources, including users, audit process, SOC, advisory team, customers, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Escalation and communication processes and lines of authority shall be established
texts.text: Escalation and communication processes and lines of authority shall be established

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All reported security events shall be analyzed before being classified as security incidents. Based on the learning from the incident, Cyber Security Team shall make necessary changes (if required) to security policies.
texts.text: All reported security events shall be analyzed before being classified as security incidents. Based on the learning from the incident, Cyber Security Team shall make necessary changes (if required) to security policies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Cyber Security Team shall conduct periodic sessions to make staff and third-party personnel aware of the procedures for identifying different types of security events.
texts.text: The Cyber Security Team shall conduct periodic sessions to make staff and third-party personnel aware of the procedures for identifying different types of security events.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All information security incidents shall be recorded in a log or equivalent (e.g. using an automated information security incident management system) and categorized according to their severity and type. GILAC shall classify incident based on incident classification criteria outlined in Security Incident Management Procedure.
texts.text: All information security incidents shall be recorded in a log or equivalent (e.g. using an automated information security incident management system) and categorized according to their severity and type. GILAC shall classify incident based on incident classification criteria outlined in Security Incident Management Procedure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · For critical incidents that need communication to be sent out to employees or customers should be done as soon possible.
texts.text: For critical incidents that need communication to be sent out to employees or customers should be done as soon possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All reported security incidents shall be responded and resolved timely, and if not, then escalated as per the classification of security incidents.
texts.text: All reported security incidents shall be responded and resolved timely, and if not, then escalated as per the classification of security incidents.

texts.label: page_footer
texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.label: page_footer

texts.text: Page 27 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber  Security  Team  shall  verify  all  reported  security  incidents  for  closure  and  conduct  postincident analysis by reviewing the appropriateness of actions taken for closure.
texts.text: Cyber  Security  Team  shall  verify  all  reported  security  incidents  for  closure  and  conduct  postincident analysis by reviewing the appropriateness of actions taken for closure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber  Security  Team  shall  investigate  the  cause  of  all  reported  security  incidents.  Wherever required, they shall also verify the implementation of recovery solutions.
texts.text: Cyber  Security  Team  shall  investigate  the  cause  of  all  reported  security  incidents.  Wherever required, they shall also verify the implementation of recovery solutions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber Security Team shall maintain a knowledge base of all security incidents and the identified solutions. This will help in providing quicker solution if the same or similar incident happens again.
texts.text: Cyber Security Team shall maintain a knowledge base of all security incidents and the identified solutions. This will help in providing quicker solution if the same or similar incident happens again.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber Security Team shall collect significant evidence for conducting necessary investigation. The events and logs shall be retained for a period as required by legal, regulatory or other compliance obligations.
texts.text: Cyber Security Team shall collect significant evidence for conducting necessary investigation. The events and logs shall be retained for a period as required by legal, regulatory or other compliance obligations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber  Security  Team  shall  conduct  post-mortem  analysis  and  reviews  to  identify  causes  of information security incidents, developing corrective actions and reassessing risk, and adjusting controls suitably to reduce the related risks in the future.
texts.text: Cyber  Security  Team  shall  conduct  post-mortem  analysis  and  reviews  to  identify  causes  of information security incidents, developing corrective actions and reassessing risk, and adjusting controls suitably to reduce the related risks in the future.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber Security Team shall perform Forensic investigations for incidents requiring investigation for legal purposes and /or severe information security incidents.
texts.text: Cyber Security Team shall perform Forensic investigations for incidents requiring investigation for legal purposes and /or severe information security incidents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All security incidents and breaches shall be discussed with management on quarterly basis.
texts.text: All security incidents and breaches shall be discussed with management on quarterly basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 20. Data Backup, Retention and Disposal Policy
texts.text: 20. Data Backup, Retention and Disposal Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information owners shall determine the backup and recovery requirements based on the criticality of information systems to prevent operational disruptions or data loss.
texts.text: Information owners shall determine the backup and recovery requirements based on the criticality of information systems to prevent operational disruptions or data loss.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Backup media shall be stored in a secure location in a off-site facility such as an alternate or backup site.
texts.text: Backup media shall be stored in a secure location in a off-site facility such as an alternate or backup site.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data recovery processes shall be tested for effectiveness on annual basis.
texts.text: Data recovery processes shall be tested for effectiveness on annual basis.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data backup shall be encrypted.
texts.text: Data backup shall be encrypted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT operations team shall identify and establish appropriate processes to meet the backup and recovery requirements determined by information owners.
texts.text: IT operations team shall identify and establish appropriate processes to meet the backup and recovery requirements determined by information owners.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data retention period shall be defined and records shall be retained for the defined period.  This shall be reviewed at least once in a year and updated with changes if any. Retention periods for data shall be decided based on the following,
texts.text: Data retention period shall be defined and records shall be retained for the defined period.  This shall be reviewed at least once in a year and updated with changes if any. Retention periods for data shall be decided based on the following,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. GILAC's business requirements,
texts.text: GILAC's business requirements,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Legal or regulatory compliances,
texts.text: Legal or regulatory compliances,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Contractual obligations.
texts.text: Contractual obligations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Records shall be maintained in a safe and secure environment. Records shall be protected from unauthorized access.
texts.text: Records shall be maintained in a safe and secure environment. Records shall be protected from unauthorized access.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All waste copies of sensitive information that are generated while copying, printing, or faxing shall be shredded using paper shredders/incinerators or shall be placed in locked bins clearly marked as containing confidential data.
texts.text: All waste copies of sensitive information that are generated while copying, printing, or faxing shall be shredded using paper shredders/incinerators or shall be placed in locked bins clearly marked as containing confidential data.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Storage media like floppy disk, hard drives, CDs, tape or optical media, zip disks, etc. shall be erased using a degaussing device or 'disk-wiping' software before being discarded.
texts.text: Storage media like floppy disk, hard drives, CDs, tape or optical media, zip disks, etc. shall be erased using a degaussing device or 'disk-wiping' software before being discarded.

texts.orig: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies
texts.text: Godrej Industries Limited and Associate Companies

texts.text: Page 28 of 41

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If the data cannot be erased, then Media shall be physically destroyed prior to disposal in such a manner that data should be beyond retrieval.
texts.text: If the data cannot be erased, then Media shall be physically destroyed prior to disposal in such a manner that data should be beyond retrieval.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Non-disclosure agreement shall be signed between the Organization and external contractor for outsourcing disposal. Certificates of secure disposal shall be obtained from external contractor.
texts.text: Non-disclosure agreement shall be signed between the Organization and external contractor for outsourcing disposal. Certificates of secure disposal shall be obtained from external contractor.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 21. Data Security Policy
texts.text: 21. Data Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall implement mechanisms to prevent the accidental disclosure of email and attachments to unauthorized individuals by enforcing encryption between email servers (e.g. using Transport Layer Security (TLS) or equivalent).
texts.text: GILAC shall implement mechanisms to prevent the accidental disclosure of email and attachments to unauthorized individuals by enforcing encryption between email servers (e.g. using Transport Layer Security (TLS) or equivalent).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Email servers shall protect messages by using digital signatures to identify if email messages have been modified in transit.
texts.text: Email servers shall protect messages by using digital signatures to identify if email messages have been modified in transit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Users shall be educated in how to protect the confidentiality and integrity of email messages (e.g. by the use of encryption, digital certificates and digital signatures).
texts.text: Users shall be educated in how to protect the confidentiality and integrity of email messages (e.g. by the use of encryption, digital certificates and digital signatures).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Security solution (e.g. DLP, IRM, etc.) should be used to identify specific types of sensitive information, monitor channels of data leakage (vectors) and take actions to prevent this data from leaking.
texts.text: Data Security solution (e.g. DLP, IRM, etc.) should be used to identify specific types of sensitive information, monitor channels of data leakage (vectors) and take actions to prevent this data from leaking.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Security solution should be configured to monitor and control the flow of sensitive data using technical Data Security solution policies, defining:
texts.text: Data Security solution should be configured to monitor and control the flow of sensitive data using technical Data Security solution policies, defining:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. what data can and cannot be sent, posted, uploaded, moved or copied and pasted.
texts.text: what data can and cannot be sent, posted, uploaded, moved or copied and pasted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. where data can be transmitted.
texts.text: where data can be transmitted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. who can send and receive data (e.g. via email).
texts.text: who can send and receive data (e.g. via email).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. how data can be shared.
texts.text: how data can be shared.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Security solution should be configured to include a register of keywords, electronic document characteristics and the specific types of sensitive information (sometimes referred to as pre-registration) that need to be protected from unauthorized disclosure.
texts.text: Data Security solution should be configured to include a register of keywords, electronic document characteristics and the specific types of sensitive information (sometimes referred to as pre-registration) that need to be protected from unauthorized disclosure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Security solution should be configured to detect sensitive data by using
texts.text: Data Security solution should be configured to detect sensitive data by using

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. described content matching, which checks data against regular expressions, defined strings, keywords, patterns or dictionaries (a list of specific terms, keywords or key phrases);
texts.text: described content matching, which checks data against regular expressions, defined strings, keywords, patterns or dictionaries (a list of specific terms, keywords or key phrases);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. fingerprinting (indexing), which takes a cryptographic hash of a sample file or file contents to create a 'fingerprint', checking content against this fingerprint for complete or partial matches (i.e. to detect either the complete text or excerpts that match the sample document)
texts.text: fingerprinting (indexing), which takes a cryptographic hash of a sample file or file contents to create a 'fingerprint', checking content against this fingerprint for complete or partial matches (i.e. to detect either the complete text or excerpts that match the sample document)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. machine learning, which uses algorithms and statistical techniques to determine if content is similar to test data, used to train the machine learning algorithm, used by the Data Security solution
texts.text: machine learning, which uses algorithms and statistical techniques to determine if content is similar to test data, used to train the machine learning algorithm, used by the Data Security solution

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. optional character recognition (image recognition), which analyses image files (e.g. screenshots or scanned documents) and extracts text to find matches for sensitive content.
texts.text: optional character recognition (image recognition), which analyses image files (e.g. screenshots or scanned documents) and extracts text to find matches for sensitive content.

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data Security solution should be configured to monitor data leakage channels where sensitive data is in motion (e.g. data traversing a network such as the internet or private network), in use (e.g. data processed on endpoint devices) or at rest (e.g. data stored in file systems, databases, the cloud or endpoint devices)
texts.text: Data Security solution should be configured to monitor data leakage channels where sensitive data is in motion (e.g. data traversing a network such as the internet or private network), in use (e.g. data processed on endpoint devices) or at rest (e.g. data stored in file systems, databases, the cloud or endpoint devices)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Backups should be encrypted to protect sensitive information, when:
texts.text: Backups should be encrypted to protect sensitive information, when:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. transmitted via a network to external storage facilities, particularly when engaging with a third party to support backup capabilities
texts.text: transmitted via a network to external storage facilities, particularly when engaging with a third party to support backup capabilities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. stored on physical media, to prevent unauthorized access in the event backups are lost or stolen in transit to an alternative location, such as an offsite storage facility
texts.text: stored on physical media, to prevent unauthorized access in the event backups are lost or stolen in transit to an alternative location, such as an offsite storage facility

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Data processed by cloud services should be protected, which includes encrypting sensitive data by using the CSP default encryption solution, configuring customer-managed key encryption or implementing customer-supplied key encryption.
texts.text: Data processed by cloud services should be protected, which includes encrypting sensitive data by using the CSP default encryption solution, configuring customer-managed key encryption or implementing customer-supplied key encryption.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · USB shall be blocked for all end-users. In case of any deviation, policy change shall be preapproved by the respective Business heads.
texts.text: USB shall be blocked for all end-users. In case of any deviation, policy change shall be preapproved by the respective Business heads.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Sensitive information shall not be kept for longer than it is required to reduce the risk of undesirable disclosure.
texts.text: Sensitive information shall not be kept for longer than it is required to reduce the risk of undesirable disclosure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information shall be deleted from systems, applications, and services in accordance with business requirements and taking into consideration relevant laws and regulations.
texts.text: Information shall be deleted from systems, applications, and services in accordance with business requirements and taking into consideration relevant laws and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · When using service suppliers for information deletion, evidence of information deletion shall be obtained from them.
texts.text: When using service suppliers for information deletion, evidence of information deletion shall be obtained from them.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 22. Capacity Management Policy
texts.text: 22. Capacity Management Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Systems capacity shall be monitored. Capacity monitoring data shall be analyzed to identify the trends and discrepancies on a regular basis, especially for critical systems.
texts.text: Systems capacity shall be monitored. Capacity monitoring data shall be analyzed to identify the trends and discrepancies on a regular basis, especially for critical systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · New business and system requirements, as well as the current and future trends for information systems usage shall be used to develop future projections for capacity requirements.
texts.text: New business and system requirements, as well as the current and future trends for information systems usage shall be used to develop future projections for capacity requirements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC  shall  identify  the  required  actionable  for  capacity  management  to  ensure  effective performance of information systems and business processes. The action plan shall identify and consider  the  capacity  requirements  based  on  business  criticality  of  the  concerned  systems, business  requirements,  Service  Level  Agreements,  Memorandums  of  Understanding,  and  risk assessments.
texts.text: GILAC  shall  identify  the  required  actionable  for  capacity  management  to  ensure  effective performance of information systems and business processes. The action plan shall identify and consider  the  capacity  requirements  based  on  business  criticality  of  the  concerned  systems, business  requirements,  Service  Level  Agreements,  Memorandums  of  Understanding,  and  risk assessments.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 23. System Acquisition, Development, Planning and Maintenance Policy
texts.text: 23. System Acquisition, Development, Planning and Maintenance Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC  shall  ensure  that  cybersecurity  requirements  are  included  in  the  entire  lifecycle  of information systems & applications, whether acquired or developed, and integrated as early as possible.
texts.text: GILAC  shall  ensure  that  cybersecurity  requirements  are  included  in  the  entire  lifecycle  of information systems & applications, whether acquired or developed, and integrated as early as possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security engineering principles should be established, documented and applied to information system engineering activities. Security should be designed into all architecture layers.
texts.text: Security engineering principles should be established, documented and applied to information system engineering activities. Security should be designed into all architecture layers.

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Godrej Information Security Policy
texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Cybersecurity function shall perform activities such as vulnerability assessments, configurations' review, for newly developed/acquired systems/applications. All findings shall be mitigated before going live in production environment.
texts.text: The Cybersecurity function shall perform activities such as vulnerability assessments, configurations' review, for newly developed/acquired systems/applications. All findings shall be mitigated before going live in production environment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Application team shall perform activities such as secure configuration, hardening and patching of new applications prior to go live.
texts.text: The Application team shall perform activities such as secure configuration, hardening and patching of new applications prior to go live.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall ensure that the development of new applications or updates to existing applications incorporate secure coding standards.
texts.text: GILAC shall ensure that the development of new applications or updates to existing applications incorporate secure coding standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Source code should be protected against unauthorized access and tampering. Access to source code  should  be  restricted  only  to  authorized  personnel.  Changes  to  source  code  should  be recorded to maintain an audit trail.
texts.text: Source code should be protected against unauthorized access and tampering. Access to source code  should  be  restricted  only  to  authorized  personnel.  Changes  to  source  code  should  be recorded to maintain an audit trail.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC  change  management  process  shall  be  followed  when  attempting  to  perform  system maintenance and updates.
texts.text: GILAC  change  management  process  shall  be  followed  when  attempting  to  perform  system maintenance and updates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All Vendor and third-party contracts shall include the cybersecurity requirements for any product/system procurement.
texts.text: All Vendor and third-party contracts shall include the cybersecurity requirements for any product/system procurement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · In case of outsourced system development, the organization shall communicate and agree requirements and expectations regarding licensing agreements, code ownership, secure design, secure coding standards, testing practices, etc. and continually monitor and review whether the delivery of outsourced work meets these expectations.
texts.text: In case of outsourced system development, the organization shall communicate and agree requirements and expectations regarding licensing agreements, code ownership, secure design, secure coding standards, testing practices, etc. and continually monitor and review whether the delivery of outsourced work meets these expectations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Operational information used for testing purposes shall be appropriately protected.
texts.text: Operational information used for testing purposes shall be appropriately protected.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Same access control procedures shall be applied to test environments as those applied to operational environments.
texts.text: Same access control procedures shall be applied to test environments as those applied to operational environments.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Usage of operational information shall be recorded to maintain an audit trail.
texts.text: Usage of operational information shall be recorded to maintain an audit trail.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Operational information shall be properly deleted from a test environment immediately after the testing is complete to prevent unauthorized use of test information.
texts.text: Operational information shall be properly deleted from a test environment immediately after the testing is complete to prevent unauthorized use of test information.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 24. Network Security Policy
texts.text: 24. Network Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall develop and approve baseline security standards for network devices.
texts.text: GILAC shall develop and approve baseline security standards for network devices.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Firewall configurations and rules shall be reviewed periodically, and at least quarterly for sensitive systems.
texts.text: Firewall configurations and rules shall be reviewed periodically, and at least quarterly for sensitive systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall provide the necessary protection when browsing and connecting to the Internet, and restrict access to suspicious websites, file storage sharing sites, and remote access sites.
texts.text: GILAC shall provide the necessary protection when browsing and connecting to the Internet, and restrict access to suspicious websites, file storage sharing sites, and remote access sites.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Managing the access rights of third parties to the network shall be in accordance with the GILAC Access Management Policy.
texts.text: Managing the access rights of third parties to the network shall be in accordance with the GILAC Access Management Policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Strong authentication and encryption techniques shall be used to ensure the protection of wireless networks.
texts.text: Strong authentication and encryption techniques shall be used to ensure the protection of wireless networks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Firewalls, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and DNS Security technologies shall be in place and updated periodically for proper logical and physical segmentation between internal corporate network and between external networks.
texts.text: Firewalls, Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), and DNS Security technologies shall be in place and updated periodically for proper logical and physical segmentation between internal corporate network and between external networks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall apply network segregation between production environment and test & development environments.
texts.text: GILAC shall apply network segregation between production environment and test & development environments.

texts.label: page_header

texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The use of physical network ports in all GILAC facilities shall be restricted by using Port Security or Port-Based Authentication technology to protect the network from the possibility of connecting unauthorized or suspicious devices without being revealed.
texts.text: The use of physical network ports in all GILAC facilities shall be restricted by using Port Security or Port-Based Authentication technology to protect the network from the possibility of connecting unauthorized or suspicious devices without being revealed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall restrict direct connection to the internet.
texts.text: GILAC shall restrict direct connection to the internet.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 25. Secure Baseline & Vulnerability Management
texts.text: 25. Secure Baseline & Vulnerability Management

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Secure Baseline standards shall be defined for all system components (endpoints/workstations, network  devices,  operating  systems,  databases,  applications  and  other  systems  which  require secure baseline) and shall be implemented across all systems.
texts.text: Secure Baseline standards shall be defined for all system components (endpoints/workstations, network  devices,  operating  systems,  databases,  applications  and  other  systems  which  require secure baseline) and shall be implemented across all systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Applications  and  IT  infrastructure  shall  be  subject  to  periodic  technical  assessments  like Application Security Review, Vulnerability Assessments and Penetration Testing.
texts.text: Applications  and  IT  infrastructure  shall  be  subject  to  periodic  technical  assessments  like Application Security Review, Vulnerability Assessments and Penetration Testing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cyber Security Team shall conduct periodic vulnerability scans as per defined cycle and share report with system owners for closure of findings.
texts.text: Cyber Security Team shall conduct periodic vulnerability scans as per defined cycle and share report with system owners for closure of findings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The vulnerabilities detected shall be remediated promptly so as to avoid exploitation of such vulnerabilities.
texts.text: The vulnerabilities detected shall be remediated promptly so as to avoid exploitation of such vulnerabilities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Penetration testing of public facing systems as well as other critical applications shall be carried out by professionally qualified teams.
texts.text: Penetration testing of public facing systems as well as other critical applications shall be carried out by professionally qualified teams.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 26. Security Patch Management Policy
texts.text: 26. Security Patch Management Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security  operations  team,  Server  team,  Network  Administrators,  Database  administrators  and Application administrators are responsible for identification and validation of all patch related issues concerning their domain of work.
texts.text: Security  operations  team,  Server  team,  Network  Administrators,  Database  administrators  and Application administrators are responsible for identification and validation of all patch related issues concerning their domain of work.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · System owners shall be responsible for deployment of patches.
texts.text: System owners shall be responsible for deployment of patches.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Application and System owners shall ensure that all patches applicable to applications and systems used by GILAC are identified.
texts.text: Application and System owners shall ensure that all patches applicable to applications and systems used by GILAC are identified.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Patches shall be tested in a test environment before being applied to production systems.
texts.text: Patches shall be tested in a test environment before being applied to production systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security Patch Management Process shall be followed to prioritize patches.
texts.text: Security Patch Management Process shall be followed to prioritize patches.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT Infrastructure team shall establish methods to protect information and systems if no patch is available for an identified vulnerability, for example, disabling services and adding additional access controls.
texts.text: IT Infrastructure team shall establish methods to protect information and systems if no patch is available for an identified vulnerability, for example, disabling services and adding additional access controls.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Delay in security patch deployment shall be tracked.
texts.text: Delay in security patch deployment shall be tracked.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · New devices shall be patched to the current patch level, as defined by the operating system vendor and supported by the application, prior to the device being connected to the production network.
texts.text: New devices shall be patched to the current patch level, as defined by the operating system vendor and supported by the application, prior to the device being connected to the production network.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · IT  infrastructure  team  shall  submit  the  patch  management  report  on  periodic  basis  to  the respective Business Units.
texts.text: IT  infrastructure  team  shall  submit  the  patch  management  report  on  periodic  basis  to  the respective Business Units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Respective system owners shall be responsible for patching of their systems.
texts.text: Respective system owners shall be responsible for patching of their systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Cyber Security Team shall track all security patch implementations using the patch dashboard or patch status report. This is to ensure that all patches are installed on all system and also to keep a track of patches which are not installed.
texts.text: The Cyber Security Team shall track all security patch implementations using the patch dashboard or patch status report. This is to ensure that all patches are installed on all system and also to keep a track of patches which are not installed.

texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 27. Audit Logging and Monitoring Policy
texts.text: 27. Audit Logging and Monitoring Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security logging, monitoring and reporting capabilities shall be implemented to detect security events  within  GILAC's  network  and  information  assets  in  accordance  with  applicable  laws, regulations and industry standards.
texts.text: Security logging, monitoring and reporting capabilities shall be implemented to detect security events  within  GILAC's  network  and  information  assets  in  accordance  with  applicable  laws, regulations and industry standards.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Logs of all critical servers, network devices and system components that support security functions (for example, firewalls, intrusion-detection systems/intrusion-prevention systems (IDS/IPS), authentication servers, etc.) shall be stored, reviewed and monitored to detect malicious activities.
texts.text: Logs of all critical servers, network devices and system components that support security functions (for example, firewalls, intrusion-detection systems/intrusion-prevention systems (IDS/IPS), authentication servers, etc.) shall be stored, reviewed and monitored to detect malicious activities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Critical Business applications and technical infrastructure shall be configured to enable event logging (standard format/syslog or equivalent).
texts.text: Critical Business applications and technical infrastructure shall be configured to enable event logging (standard format/syslog or equivalent).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Critical Business applications and technical infrastructure shall generate appropriate event types (e.g. Object creation, login attempts etc.)
texts.text: Critical Business applications and technical infrastructure shall generate appropriate event types (e.g. Object creation, login attempts etc.)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The logs generated shall have relevant event attributes in event entries (e.g. IP address, username, time and date, protocol used, port accessed, method of connection, name of device and object name, etc.)
texts.text: The logs generated shall have relevant event attributes in event entries (e.g. IP address, username, time and date, protocol used, port accessed, method of connection, name of device and object name, etc.)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All systems shall use a trusted source for date and time to ensure logs use accurate time stamps. The trusted time source shall be synched with global atomic clocks for accurate timing.
texts.text: All systems shall use a trusted source for date and time to ensure logs use accurate time stamps. The trusted time source shall be synched with global atomic clocks for accurate timing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Critical servers and network devices shall be configured to log / alert creation and deletion of system-level objects.
texts.text: Critical servers and network devices shall be configured to log / alert creation and deletion of system-level objects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Critical servers and network devices shall be configured to log / alert initialization, stopping or pausing of the audit logs.
texts.text: Critical servers and network devices shall be configured to log / alert initialization, stopping or pausing of the audit logs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security relevant logging shall be enabled at all times.
texts.text: Security relevant logging shall be enabled at all times.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Logs shall be protected against unauthorized access, misuse and modification. Sufficient storage space shall be allocated based on expected volume of logs.
texts.text: Logs shall be protected against unauthorized access, misuse and modification. Sufficient storage space shall be allocated based on expected volume of logs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security-related  event  logs  shall  be  analyzed  regularly  to  help  identify  anomalies.  Anomalies detected shall generate alerts in SIEM (Security information and event management) tool. Various use-cases to be defined in SIEM to detect security events covering all possible threat landscapes.
texts.text: Security-related  event  logs  shall  be  analyzed  regularly  to  help  identify  anomalies.  Anomalies detected shall generate alerts in SIEM (Security information and event management) tool. Various use-cases to be defined in SIEM to detect security events covering all possible threat landscapes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Security Operations Center (SOC) team shall monitor security alerts generated in the SIEM tool 24x7. Any incident identified or reported shall be handled as per Incident Management process.
texts.text: Security Operations Center (SOC) team shall monitor security alerts generated in the SIEM tool 24x7. Any incident identified or reported shall be handled as per Incident Management process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analyzed to produce threat intelligence.
texts.text: Information relating to information security threats shall be collected and analyzed to produce threat intelligence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · User accounts shall be monitored regularly to detect any unwanted privileges, orphan accounts, and dormant accounts. Any accounts detected in violation of GILAC's policies shall be suspended or terminated.
texts.text: User accounts shall be monitored regularly to detect any unwanted privileges, orphan accounts, and dormant accounts. Any accounts detected in violation of GILAC's policies shall be suspended or terminated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The logging of security-related events should be reviewed on quarterly basis to verify whether alerts are getting triggered in SIEM as per configured use-case.
texts.text: The logging of security-related events should be reviewed on quarterly basis to verify whether alerts are getting triggered in SIEM as per configured use-case.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Audit logs shall be retained for at least one year and shall be readily available for last 3 months.
texts.text: Audit logs shall be retained for at least one year and shall be readily available for last 3 months.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization shall also subscribe and connect with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations with the aim to improve knowledge about best practices, receive early warnings of alerts, advisories and patches pertaining to attacks and vulnerabilities and stay up to date with relevant security information.
texts.text: The organization shall also subscribe and connect with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations with the aim to improve knowledge about best practices, receive early warnings of alerts, advisories and patches pertaining to attacks and vulnerabilities and stay up to date with relevant security information.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 28. Network Time Protocol
texts.text: 28. Network Time Protocol

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The real time clock of systems shall be set accurately to ensure the accuracy of audit logs, which may be required for investigation or as evidence in legal or disciplinary cases.
texts.text: The real time clock of systems shall be set accurately to ensure the accuracy of audit logs, which may be required for investigation or as evidence in legal or disciplinary cases.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The real time clock of systems and communication devices shall be in sync with central NTP server. Further there shall be procedure that checks and corrects drift in the real time clock.
texts.text: The real time clock of systems and communication devices shall be in sync with central NTP server. Further there shall be procedure that checks and corrects drift in the real time clock.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 29. Anti-Virus Policy
texts.text: 29. Anti-Virus Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All servers, desktops and laptops shall have anti-virus agent installed. Infrastructure Team shall ensure  that  all  new  systems  including  desktops,  laptops,  and  servers  have  anti-virus  agent installed, pre-loaded and configured before provisioning.
texts.text: All servers, desktops and laptops shall have anti-virus agent installed. Infrastructure Team shall ensure  that  all  new  systems  including  desktops,  laptops,  and  servers  have  anti-virus  agent installed, pre-loaded and configured before provisioning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Anti-virus agent installation shall be password protected to ensure that end users cannot uninstall the agent. The anti-virus agent shall be configured in such a way that end users will not have privileges to change any settings or to disable the agent.
texts.text: Anti-virus agent installation shall be password protected to ensure that end users cannot uninstall the agent. The anti-virus agent shall be configured in such a way that end users will not have privileges to change any settings or to disable the agent.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Anti-virus agent shall be configured to scan the machine at least once every week. The scanning can be scheduled during non-peak usage hours.
texts.text: Anti-virus agent shall be configured to scan the machine at least once every week. The scanning can be scheduled during non-peak usage hours.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Anti-virus agent shall be configured to scan all removable disks before use.
texts.text: Anti-virus agent shall be configured to scan all removable disks before use.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Anti-virus agent shall be configured to quarantine virus infected files if they cannot be cleaned.
texts.text: Anti-virus agent shall be configured to quarantine virus infected files if they cannot be cleaned.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to websites and other resources on the internet known to host malicious content shall be prevented using the web content filtering tool. Antivirus software shall be installed on the Internet Proxy and if feasible configured to scan downloads/uploads for malicious code.
texts.text: Access to websites and other resources on the internet known to host malicious content shall be prevented using the web content filtering tool. Antivirus software shall be installed on the Internet Proxy and if feasible configured to scan downloads/uploads for malicious code.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC  shall  employ  anti-malware  signature  auto  update  features.  After  applying  an  update, automated systems shall verify that each system has received its signature update. The GILAC shall monitor anti-virus console logs to correct any systems that failed to be updated.
texts.text: GILAC  shall  employ  anti-malware  signature  auto  update  features.  After  applying  an  update, automated systems shall verify that each system has received its signature update. The GILAC shall monitor anti-virus console logs to correct any systems that failed to be updated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Infrastructure team shall submit monthly reports on the status of the Anti-Virus protection to the Cyber Security Team.
texts.text: Infrastructure team shall submit monthly reports on the status of the Anti-Virus protection to the Cyber Security Team.

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: 31. Third-party Management Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The information security requirements and controls shall be formally documented in a contractual agreement which may be part of, or an addendum to, the main commercial contract.
texts.text: The information security requirements and controls shall be formally documented in a contractual agreement which may be part of, or an addendum to, the main commercial contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Confidentiality and non-disclosure of GILAC data shall be addressed in vendor contracts using legally enforceable terms.
texts.text: Confidentiality and non-disclosure of GILAC data shall be addressed in vendor contracts using legally enforceable terms.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Appropriate legal advice shall be obtained to ensure that contractual documentation is valid within the country in which it is to be applied.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: If required then separate Non- Disclosure agreement shall be made on Government stamp paper and it shall be used where a more specific level of control over confidentiality is required.

texts.text: Godrej Information Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Contracts with third-party vendors shall include terms for complete deletion of data/ information at the end of the Agreement.
texts.text: Contracts with third-party vendors shall include terms for complete deletion of data/ information at the end of the Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Contracts shall also outline clauses for notification and reporting of unauthorized disclosure or confidential information leakage to GILAC within the agreed timeframe.
texts.text: Contracts shall also outline clauses for notification and reporting of unauthorized disclosure or confidential information leakage to GILAC within the agreed timeframe.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Appropriate due diligence shall be exercised in the selection and approval of new vendor/supplier before contracts are agreed.
texts.text: Appropriate due diligence shall be exercised in the selection and approval of new vendor/supplier before contracts are agreed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The information security provisions in place at existing suppliers (where due diligence was not undertaken as part of initial selection) shall be clearly understood and improved where necessary.
texts.text: The information security provisions in place at existing suppliers (where due diligence was not undertaken as part of initial selection) shall be clearly understood and improved where necessary.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The supplier shall be expected to exercise adequate control over the information security policies and procedures used within sub-contractors who play apart in the supply chain of delivery of goods or services to Godrej.
texts.text: The supplier shall be expected to exercise adequate control over the information security policies and procedures used within sub-contractors who play apart in the supply chain of delivery of goods or services to Godrej.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Godrej shall have all rights to audit the information security practices of the vendor/supplier and, where appropriate sub-contractors.
texts.text: Godrej shall have all rights to audit the information security practices of the vendor/supplier and, where appropriate sub-contractors.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The selection of required controls shall be based upon a comprehensive risk assessment taking into  account  Information  Security  requirements,  the  product  or  services  to  be  supplied,  its criticality to the organization and compatibility of the suppliers.
texts.text: The selection of required controls shall be based upon a comprehensive risk assessment taking into  account  Information  Security  requirements,  the  product  or  services  to  be  supplied,  its criticality to the organization and compatibility of the suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · For  those  vendors/suppliers  that  were  not  subject  to  information  security  due  diligence assessment  being  made,  an  evaluation  process  shall  be  undertaken  in  order  to  identify  any required improvements.
texts.text: For  those  vendors/suppliers  that  were  not  subject  to  information  security  due  diligence assessment  being  made,  an  evaluation  process  shall  be  undertaken  in  order  to  identify  any required improvements.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · SLA and performance of vendors/suppliers shall be monitored and reviewed as per contractual agreements on bi-annual basis.
texts.text: SLA and performance of vendors/suppliers shall be monitored and reviewed as per contractual agreements on bi-annual basis.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 32. Cloud Security Policy
texts.text: 32. Cloud Security Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall perform an assessment of the cloud service provider (CSP) prior to onboarding.
texts.text: GILAC shall perform an assessment of the cloud service provider (CSP) prior to onboarding.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Procurement and Legal teams shall include the necessary legal, non-disclosure, business continuity and disaster recovery clauses in the CSP contract.
texts.text: The Procurement and Legal teams shall include the necessary legal, non-disclosure, business continuity and disaster recovery clauses in the CSP contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Data Owner/Custodian shall classify the data being hosted/stored at the CSP as per the 'GILAC Information Classification Scheme'.
texts.text: The Data Owner/Custodian shall classify the data being hosted/stored at the CSP as per the 'GILAC Information Classification Scheme'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization shall ensure that the CSP's data privacy policy complies with the applicable laws.
texts.text: The organization shall ensure that the CSP's data privacy policy complies with the applicable laws.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The IT team should implement the necessary cryptography controls for the data as per the data classification and on the network channel.
texts.text: The IT team should implement the necessary cryptography controls for the data as per the data classification and on the network channel.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Contracts with CSP shall include clauses for complete deletion of data/ information at the end of the Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Contract shall also include clauses for the return of data to the organization and that there is no vendor-lock in period defined by the CSP.
texts.text: Contract shall also include clauses for the return of data to the organization and that there is no vendor-lock in period defined by the CSP.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Wherever applicable, GILAC shall align its Cloud Security controls with industry good practices such as CIS benchmark.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Roles and responsibilities for protecting the cloud environment should be agreed with the CSP, including shared responsibilities and the need for collaboration.
texts.text: Roles and responsibilities for protecting the cloud environment should be agreed with the CSP, including shared responsibilities and the need for collaboration.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: GILAC shall ensure monitoring of security-related events and logs for cloud systems.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The IT team shall implement the appropriate access permissions for the cloud environment as per the 'GILAC Access Management Policy'.
texts.text: The IT team shall implement the appropriate access permissions for the cloud environment as per the 'GILAC Access Management Policy'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Access to cloud-based services shall be provided using multi-factor authentication mechanism.
texts.text: Access to cloud-based services shall be provided using multi-factor authentication mechanism.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Secure methods of connecting to cloud services shall be provided, which may include applying HTTPS (TLS) to all network traffic, configuring a virtual private network (VPN) for sensitive traffic and/or implementing a wide area network (WAN) solution for critical and/or highly sensitive information, segmenting networks by implementing virtual local area networks (VLANs), etc.

texts.text: The IT team should perform periodic backups of data hosted/stored on cloud environment as per 'GILAC Data backup & restoration policy'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · GILAC shall conduct an organizational assessment of risk prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services and that the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services is approved by Cyber Security Team within the organization.
texts.text: GILAC shall conduct an organizational assessment of risk prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services and that the acquisition or outsourcing of dedicated information security services is approved by Cyber Security Team within the organization.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization performs scans to identify vulnerabilities in the cloud environment as well as applications hosted in the cloud as per GILAC's Vulnerability Management Policy.
texts.text: The organization performs scans to identify vulnerabilities in the cloud environment as well as applications hosted in the cloud as per GILAC's Vulnerability Management Policy.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Information security awareness, education and training programs about cloud services shall be provided to employees and the supervising managers, including those of business units.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: The organization shall perform penetration testing at a defined frequency on cloud information systems and application hosted.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Information security events shall be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible. The mechanisms for incident reporting shall be agreed with the CSP as part of the agreement.
texts.text: Information security events shall be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible. The mechanisms for incident reporting shall be agreed with the CSP as part of the agreement.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Organizations shall regularly monitor, review and audit supplier/ CSP service delivery & SLA to ensure CSP complies to GILAC's Information Security Policies.

texts.text: 33. Cryptography Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Confidentiality, integrity, authenticity and non-repudiation of business-critical information during its transmission over un-trusted networks shall be maintained.
texts.text: Confidentiality, integrity, authenticity and non-repudiation of business-critical information during its transmission over un-trusted networks shall be maintained.

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.orig: 36.1. Compliance Management
